title: Titus 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a taut sinewy wine, generous in oak, with a bite of powerful ripeness. Cherry cola, vanilla and biscuit add richness to the flavor profile, with streaks of black pepper and cinnamon chiming in.

title: Valiano 2013 6.38 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this presents with aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and forest floor. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, clove, tobacco and a touch of cedar alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Weixelbaum 2015 Anno Dazumal Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)
description: A very earthy tone recalling bruised apple and yeast dominates the nose of this wine. The creamy, soft and rounded palate combines these fruity and savory elements. Citrus pithiness lends texture to the warming finish.

title: Wilderotter 2014 Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine has more concentration than average, adding accents of black pepper and smoke to the varietal's famously fruity flavors. The texture is nicely firm, having support from moderate tannins, so it invites a pairing with substantial proteins.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Conte Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is made from a field-blended vineyard planted in 1995. Ripe, juicy and dusty, it's a well-integrated wine that holds its high level of succulence and concentration well, showing a sweetness of vanilla oak that's nicely offset by black pepper and leather accents.

title: Winzer Krems 2016 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's yeasty nose tinged with celery salt and lemon zestiness is very appetizing. The palate continues with this very attractive fruity-savory combination, adding a lovely creaminess against which the tangy herbal and lemon notes shine.

title: Broccardo 2013 Paiagallo  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, culinary spice and a whiff of French oak waft out of the glass. The taut, linear palate offers cranberry, licorice and coffee bean alongside firm, close-grained tannins that give the finish grip. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Forest floor, tobacco leaf and charred earth aromas lead the way. It's full-bodied, savory and already accessible, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, ripe cranberry, licorice and graphite offset by firm, velvety tannins. It closes on a salty note. Drink through 2023.

title: Carmen 2015 Gran Reserva El Peñasco Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Compact, almost closed aromas of prune, blackberry, tire rubber and clove announce a dark, well-oaked Carmenère. A firm palate of commendable structure is unflinching, while flavors of ripe blackberry, cassis and light herbs carry through to the steady finish.

title: Casa Emma 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: You'll find aromas suggesting underbrush, toasted oak, tobacco, new leather and a balsamic note on this firm red. The medium-bodied palate offers dried blackberry, prune, orange zest, clove and espresso framed in gripping, close-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Borgo Scopeto 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Enticing aromas of fragrant purple flowers, ripe woodland berries and a whiff of pressed powder waft out of the glass. Bright and juicy, the savory palate shows crushed raspberry, fleshy Morello cherry, ground clove and a hint of coffee alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Borgogno 2012 Cannubi  (Barolo)
description: Dark berry, pipe tobacco, chopped herb and forest floor aromas carry over to the polished palate along with dried cherry, orange peel and ground clove. Firm, refined tannins provide elegant support. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Cloudy Bay 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Smokey and earthy in style, notes of charred meat, blackberry, black olive and dried oregano are all followed by a savory palate with medium tannins. This is a love/hate wine where winemaking prowess overpowers terroirs.

title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: These growers, based in Villié-Morgon, have produced a structured wine from arguably the top area of Morgon. It is full of tannins as well as berry fruits. It is not especially dense and the cherry flavors give the wine an attractive crisp texture and aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016  Morgon
description: Vines close to the family winery are the source of this rich, structured wine. It has power and great definition with its spice, firm tannins and solid texture. The wine needs to age further, so drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Chamodère  (Régnié)
description: Producer Cédric Lecareux makes rich wines, typically with some wood aging that enhances the ripe fruits. This wine, produced from organic grapes, is in this mold, juicy with black fruits that are lightly cut by acidity. It should be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Casa Sola 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Moist underbrush, toasted oak and a whiff of camphor lead the nose. The linear, mid-weight palate shows juicy black cherry, licorice and other oak-driven spices framed in vibrant firm acidity while austere, fine-grained tannins grip the finish. Give it a few more years to mellow and fully come together.

title: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Clos Cuvée Jadis  (Beaujolais-Leynes)
description: This wine is released after 22 months in oak that gave it a delightful perfume and flavors of mint as well as black cherries. A firm tannic structure backed by the ripe fruit will likely allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château des Gimarets 2015 Tradition  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This rich wine, the product of the ripe 2015 vintage, is generous, full and packed with still-developing tannins. Its structure and good acidity are still in place, indicating the wine needs to age further. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Badia a Coltibuono 2015 RS  (Chianti Classico)
description: This delicious, easygoing red boasts typical Sangiovese aromas of wild berry, crushed violet and a whiff dark spice. The juicy, enjoyable palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, fleshy plum and cake spice while supple tannins provide smooth support. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Abore Sacra Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from biodynamic-certified grapes grown on a coastal-influenced property, this wine is bright in cherry and cardamom spice, with fully realized elements of forest pine, gravel and pomegranate. Fully oaked and somewhat tannic in its youth, it shows vigor and vibrancy as it finishes.

title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)
description: This six-acre parcel has produced a structured but fruity wine. With crisp red berries and a layer of tannins to sustain the fruitiness, it is likely to mature well, with concentration and a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

title: Empire Estate 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Clear and focused on the nose, this wine brings crushed stone, lemon-lime and peach blossom aromas into the mix. The clean-cut palate is lithe, with crisp green apple and tart quince riding along a streamlined river of acidity. A delightfully astringent quinine finish keeps this taut and refreshing.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Spring Hills Vineyard Flora (Russian River Valley)
description: Described as a cross between Gewürztraminer and Sémillon created in 1938, this unique white is exotic on the nose in aromatic apple blossom and honeysuckle, its texture dry and salty. It has a strong flavor of fig complemented by green apple.

title: Foley 2015 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cola, Montmorency cherry juice, star anise and sagebrush aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft, easy and familiar on the palate, with clove spice giving depth to the cooked raspberry and strawberry flavors.

title: François Lurton 2015 Hacienda Araucano Alka Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Fully ripe aromas of animal hide and dark-berry fruits blend with heavy oak notes that are borderline chemical and like paint. A massive, extracted palate almost goes overboard but remains within the realm of balance. Flavors of clove, burnt oak and blackberry are dense, baked and outright woody on the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: The top wine from this estate comes from the famed Côte du Py vineyard. This wine is densely structured, full of tannins and with great potential. Black fruit is still developing under the dry texture but will surely be there in a few months. Drink from late 2018.
designation: Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py

title: Halos de Jupiter 2015  Gigondas
description: Rich black-cherry and berry flavors are unctuously ripe, almost syrupy, but offset by sunny acidity and a pleasantly silky mouthfeel. This wine is unabashedly fruity and forward yet maintains a fresh, pretty demeanor and a soft, supple finish.

title: Heinrich Hartl 2016 Classic Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)
description: A gentle vanilla note wraps itself around ripe, red cherry on the nose, with a slight touch of smoky mocha. The palate combines these flavors and presents them on a juicy palate held firm by a fine mesh of tannins. This has bite and ample freshness.

title: Henry Fessy 2016 Château des Labourons  (Fleurie)
description: Some wood aging has given this single-estate wine its smooth, polished character. Along with having the concentration of old vines, this wine is rich, generous and likely to age well. Drink from late 2018.
